授業目的:
To continue to develop
the listening and speaking skills learned in the Spring semester to more
effectively participate in interactions relevant to the lives of university
students in Japan. This includes discussing day-to-day activities in English as
well as completing paired or group presentations and small-group discussions.
到達目標:
By the end of the course, learners will be better able to:*speak more fluently on selected topics and tasks; *use a range of interaction strategies and relevant language
to communicate effectively in group work, discussions and daily-life
conversations; *present ideas using a coherent structure, appropriate
connecting language, and paralinguistic skills (e.g. eye contact,
posture/gestures) for individual presentations; *use visual aids (e.g. poster/ppt) to effectively support
presentation content;*understand English spoken at a rate comparable to slow,
natural speech;  *understand and produce selected features of connected
speech common to native speaker English; *understand English spoken in a range of non-native speaker
accents;*understand and use topic-specific and general,
mid-frequency vocabulary items.
特記事項: 【合併】英語Iｄ　１１（経済学部）/英語IIｂ　１１（経済学部）
授業方法:
Classes will be interactive and group-work based, with some
language and skills guidance from the teacher. Learners are expected to
participate actively in all tasks to gain the maximum benefit to their spoken
English skills. There will be a range of spoken tasks, including group
discussions, presentations, supported by reading & listening tasks.
Materials will include a selection from the textbook as well as additional
materials distributed in class and on LUNA.

第1回: Spring semester review & fall semester introduction; Summer vacation discussion; diagnostic vocabulary assessment.
第7回: Speaking test reflection and lesson 8 preparation
第11回: Lesson review and presentation planning (1 hour)
